articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Hamhung Chemical Industry Univ.
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Hamhung Chemical Industry Univ.
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the Hamhung University of Chemical Industry.
					 He saw data on the achievements made by the university in scientific researches in recent years.
					
					 The university has waged a dynamic drive to devotedly implement the militant tasks set forth by him while giving field guidance to it in November four years ago, thus successfully carrying out a lot of valuable research subjects which are of weighty importance in the development of the nation's industry.
					
					 After receiving a report on the researches, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the teaching staff and students of the university succeeded in the researches into fresh cutting-edge technology by devoting their wisdom and enthusiasm. This precious success once again clearly shows the inexhaustible creative ingenuity and talents of the technical personnel who have grown under the care of the WPK, he noted.
					
					 Making the rounds of laboratories furnished with cutting-edge equipment and other places, he acquainted himself in detail with the education at the university and its scientific researches.
					
					 He was greatly pleased to learn that the teaching staff of the university have created good environment for education and brought about a new turn in education and scientific researches as required by the developing reality.
					
					 He said that the university founded at the personal initiative of President Kim Il Sung is a university of merit as it has trained many able technical personnel who would shoulder upon themselves the nation's chemical industry over the past years, thereby making a great contribution to building a rich and powerful country. 
					
					 Saying that a great many graduates from the university are now playing a pivotal role in settling lots of scientific and technological problems arising in various domains of the national economy including chemical industry and exploring new scientific and technical fields, he emphasized that the party and people would always remember the feats performed by the teaching staff and students of the university for the party, the revolution, the country and the people.
					
					  He met educationists and researchers who have rendered distinguished services for the education of the younger generation and scientific researches while working at the university for years and gave a warm pep-talk to them.
					
					 Praising teachers and researchers as loyal revolutionaries who devoted their all to the prosperity of the country, he highly estimated their feats and had a photograph taken with them.
					
					 He advanced important tasks to be carried out by the university.
					
					 Only when lots of competent and versatile reserve scientists and technicians are trained is it possible to develop the nation's economy and put its science and technology on the world's level in the shortest possible period, he said, underscoring the need for the university to train many more technical personnel capable of making a positive contribution to further consolidating the foundation of the independent national economy and giving fullest play to its potential.
					
					 He called on the university to train many more scientists and technicians high at technological level in a short period and thus solve immediate problems arising in putting the national economy on a Juche, modern and scientific basis and, at the same time, widely explore new scientific and technological fields of great importance in developing the nation's chemical industry.
					
					 In order to develop science and technology as required by the age of knowledge-based economy, it is necessary to firmly arm students with new technical knowledge, he said, underlining the need to briskly conduct the work to introduce advanced technology while keeping in close touch with scientific and research institutions and universities.
					
					 He stressed the need to make an effective use of laboratories at the best level and train students as able technical personnel and brave persons pushing back the frontiers of the latest science and technology.
					
					 In order to support the advance of the Korean people for a great revolutionary surge in the drive for building a rich and powerful country with science and technology, it is important to steadily increase the ranks of scientists and technicians, he said, calling for scaling as early as possible the high eminence of a thriving nation by dint of science and technology.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the whole teaching staff and all students of the university would bear deep in mind the importance of their duties for developing the nation's chemical industry and bring about a fresh turn in training scientific and technical personnel and developing science and technology.
					
					 He was accompanied by Thae Jong Su, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, Secretary Kim Ki Nam, Department Directors Kim Kyong Hui and Jang Song Thaek and First Vice Department Directors Ju Kyu Chang and Ri Je Gang of the WPK Central Committee and Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su, department directors of the NDC.

articles.title: CPRK Accuses S.Korea of Linking Ship Sinking with North
articles.content:
CPRK Accuses S.Korea of Linking Ship Sinking with North
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) issued a statement on Friday assailing the south Korean puppet forces for releasing extremely provocative "results of the investigation" into the sinking of a warship of the south Korean puppet navy in a bid to hurl mud at the north.
					 The statement noted that the publication of the above-said "results of the investigation" is another extremely ridiculous charade staged by the puppet group in a bid to hurt the dignity of the DPRK, steadily tighten the "sanctions" against it, harm and suffocate it in conspiracy with its U.S. and Japanese masters, much upset by the might of the Republic advancing by leaps and bounds toward a thriving nation.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group, while working with bloodshot eyes to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen, drew the conclusion from the day the case occurred that the warship was "sunken by the north" and has since conducted intensive investigation on its basis to hatch a plot, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 In the course of nearly two month-long investigation the puppet group fabricated what it called "circumstantial evidence" with conjecture, supposition and random guess. It just produced fragments and pieces of aluminum whose origin remains unknown as "evidence," becoming the target of derision.
					
					 Greatly irony is that it deliberately linked the case with the north, talking about the results of the analysis of composition of the unidentified "evidence" without any marking and its size and type.
					
					 This is nothing but a shameful deed of those keen on escalating the confrontation with the north.
					
					 The Lee group's assertion that the above-said case is linked with the north is the last-ditch effort of those who face destruction as it is a premeditated and deliberate plot to tide over a serious crisis created due to the total failure of its domestic and foreign policies and smoothly stage the "elections to the local self-governing bodies" in a bid to maintain the fascist rule and bring the inter-Korean relations to a collapse. 
					
					 The puppet forces are now kicking up such fuss as creating atmosphere reminiscent of a wartime situation in south Korea, blustering they would not "rule out a war" and crying out for "counter-measures", urgently evacuating the personnel, equipment and materials of the south side from the areas of the north side and issuing top secret order for taking steps for personal safety and making preparations for withdrawal. 
					
					 This racket reminding one of an eve of a war goes to prove that the group's recent publication of the "results of investigation" was not a mere clarification of the sinking of the warship but a carefully calculated provocation to seek a pretext for igniting a war of aggression against the north together with outside forces. 
					
					 The puppet group has created such grave situation on the Korean Peninsula that a war may break out right now.
					
					 Pursuant to the statement issued by a spokesman for the National Defence Commission, the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea solemnly declares as follows, speaking for the DPRK government authorities: 
					
					 Firstly, from now on the DPRK will regard the present situation as the phase of a war and decisively handle all matters arising in the inter-Korean relations to cope with it. 
					
					 Secondly, in case the puppet group opts for "counter-action" and "retaliation" under the pretext of the sinking of the warship, the DPRK will strongly react to them with such merciless punishment as the total freeze of the inter-Korean relations, the complete abrogation of the north-south agreement on non-aggression and a total halt to the inter-Korean cooperation undertakings.
					
					 The DPRK will never pardon anyone hurting its supreme dignity and doing harm to it, warned the statement.

articles.title: Foreign Ministry US of Linking with S. Korean ship Sinking
articles.content:
Foreign Ministry US of Linking with S. Korean ship Sinking
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry issued a statement on Friday denouncing the United States for pulling up the DPRK, absurdly asserting that the sinking of a south Korean warship was an attack made by north Korea and challenge to the international peace and security.
					 This betrays the intention of the U.S. to stir up the atmosphere of international pressure upon the DPRK by backing the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors of south Korea, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 This indicates that the U.S. is invariably pursuing a hostile policy towards the DPRK to isolate and stifle it.
					
					 As the DPRK had already clarified, it has nothing to do with the case. The DPRK has always abided by international law but the U.S. made such absurd assertion which reminds one of a thief crying "Stop the thief!" 
					
					 The fabrication of the case and the "results of the investigation into it" are, in the final analysis, nothing but a farce orchestrated by the group of traitors with the approval of the U.S. and under its patronage.  
					
					 The U.S. claimed that there was hardly any side which was ready to do so except north Korea and that the cause of the sinking of the warship was most likely a torpedo attack by north Korea even before the announcement of the results of the investigation, paying lip-service to scientific and objective investigation. From the very day the case occurred, the U.S. branded the DPRK as a "suspect" and led the investigation into the case in that direction. 
					
					 Prompted by its miscalculation that the DPRK would yield to its sanctions, the U.S. chose to shun dialogue and negotiations under the signboard of strategic patience. The DPRK and the U.S. were in negotiations over the issue of holding another round of talks in New York in the wake of the Pyongyang bilateral talks held in December of 2009. This was part of the efforts to finally revive the framework of the six-party talks according to the third phase proposal made by China, the host country of the talks.
					
					 But the Obama administration of the Democratic Party which was defeated by the Republican Party in the by-election to the Senate that took place in January after it was criticized for being weak in the foreign policy again made a switchover to a hard-line policy, totally derailing even the process for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula by linking the DPRK with the above-said case.
					
					 It is the intention of the present U.S. administration to suffocate the DPRK politically and economically by internationalizing the sanctions against the latter and use south Korea as a servant for executing its Asian strategy. The U.S., however, should know that it is not so easy to pull the wool over the eyes of the world people.  
					
					 They vividly remember upbeat and "persuasive" U.S. Secretary of State Powell reading top secret information about the existence of weapons of mass destruction in Iraq for 70 minutes at the meeting of the UN Security Council held in February of 2003. It was with such unprecedented lie that the U.S. justified an armed invasion of Iraq and it is still not free from such disgraceful fallout.  Should the U.S. tell another lie on the Korean Peninsula and let its running dogs strain the situation, they will have to pay a price incomparably dearer than what the U.S. has done for the Iraqi war. 
					
					 The U.S. and its vassal forces will witness only the reality of prospering socialist Korea quite contrary to what they had dreamed for such a long time. 
					
					 It is the invariable policy of the DPRK to realize the denuclearization of the peninsula and protect the stability and peace of the region but it will not allow any slightest act to infringe upon its sovereignty and right to existence.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Yemeni President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Yemeni President
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Ali Abdullah Saleh, president of Yemen, on the occasion of its 20th national day.
					 Kim in the message noted that the Yemeni government and people have achieved a lot of successes in their efforts to consolidate the unification and security of the country and promote the national unity and economic development over the last 20 years.
					
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop, the message wished the president successes in his work for the progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: SPA Greets Chongryon Congress
articles.content:
SPA Greets Chongryon Congress
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK Friday sent a message of greetings to the 22nd Congress of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 Over the past three years since its 21st Congress Chongryon and Koreans in Japan have firmly protected itself, bravely overcoming manifold difficulties and ordeals, and gained precious achievements and a wealth of experience in the sacred struggle to usher in a fresh heyday in the movement of Koreans in Japan, the message said, and went on:
					
					 Keeping pace with the dynamic general advance of the people in the homeland, Chongryon should give full play to the mental power and potentials of its officials and compatriots and thereby bring its overall work to normal and put it on a higher stage and continue glorifying the honor as a patriotic pioneer and a model in the movement of overseas compatriots in the new century, too.
					
					 Chongryon should make a tangible contribution to accomplishing the independent reunification of the country and the cause of building a great prosperous and powerful nation, positively promote the friendship with the Japanese people, boost solidarity with the world progressives and thus create environment favorable for the development of its work and the Korean community in Japan.
					
					 Expressing belief that the 22nd Congress of Chongryon would prove to be one of victory and unity, inheritance and innovation to be specially recorded in the history of the movement of Koreans in Japan and mark an occasion in providing a springboard from which to usher in a new heyday of the patriotic cause, the message wished it good success in its work.

articles.title: Buddhist Masses Held
articles.content:
Buddhist Masses Held
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The "north-south simultaneous Buddhist masses to celebrate the birthday of Buddha" took place at temples in different parts of the DPRK on Friday. 
					 Present there were office-bearers of the Central Committee of the Buddhist Federation of Korea and its provincial, city and county committees, priests and monks of temples and believers. 
					
					 Rituals were made to be followed by speeches. And a joint prayer was read out at masses.
					
					 The speakers said that they are celebrating the birthday of Buddha at a stirring time when all the people across the country are turning out as one in the last charge for building a great prosperous and powerful nation to perform fresh miracles and innovation everyday. They called upon the Buddhists to make tangible contributions to building a thriving nation through substantial participation in various activities. 
					
					 They noted that due to the present south Korean conservative ruling forces' sycophancy toward the U.S. and Japan and their moves for a war against the DPRK, a confrontational phase in which a nuclear war may break out has been created in Korea where the warm wave of the national reconciliation, unity, cooperation and reunification swept, bringing about eye-opening events, unprecedented in the history of the division, guided by the idea of "By our nation itself".
					
					 They called upon all the Buddhists in the north and the south and abroad to unite in Dharma-minded concord and actively turn out in practical actions to foil the Lee Myung Bak group's war moves and thoroughly preserve and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, its action programme.

articles.title: DPRK Beats Thai in AFC Women's Asian Cup
articles.content:
DPRK Beats Thai in AFC Women's Asian Cup
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The AFC Women's Asian Cup 2010 was kicked off on Wednesday.
					 The AFC Women's Asian Cup 2010 which will last till May 30 in Chengdu of China brought together teams of eight countries and regions.
					
					 The teams of the DPRK, Myanmar, Thailand and Japan belong to Group A of league matches.
					
					 The DPRK team trounced its Thai rival 3:0 in the first match with it held on Thursday.
					
					 It will meet with its Myanmar rival on May 22.

articles.title: Musical Anecdotage Published
articles.content:
Musical Anecdotage Published
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The musical anecdotage "General Kim Jong Il and Songs" (second volume) was recently published by the Art and Literature Publishing House.
					 The five-part book contains 126 musical anecdotes about General Secretary Kim Jong Il's energetic guidance over the work of music and arts.
					
					 Part 1 carries episodes in him who provided tireless guidance to make sure that such songs praising the revolutionary life, undying exploits and noble personality of President Kim Il Sung as "Cantata to Marshal Kim Il Sung", "We Live in the Embrace of the Leader" and "Leader, the Night Is Far Advanced" resounded forth.
					
					 Part 2 deals with historic episodes which were told in the days when songs calling for devotedly defending the leader and songs praising the country, loved by our army and people, were created and disseminated under the far-reaching plan and energetic leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Part 3 carries touching episodes saying that Kim Jong Il, genius of music and arts, developed the Juche-oriented music and arts onto a new higher stage suited to the emotion of the era and the thinking and sentiments of the Korean people.
					
					 Parts 4 and 5 deal with moving stories telling that he wisely guided the work to make every song created in the era of Songun a powerful weapon encouraging the revolutionary cause of Juche to victory and a solemn march for the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation and that he showed profound trust and warm love for the creators and artistes.

articles.title: Extracurricular Activities Center for Schoolchildren
articles.content:
Extracurricular Activities Center for Schoolchildren
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Students and Children's Palace helps schoolchildren widen their knowledge through their extracurricular activities.
					 Sin Yong Chol, a section chief of the palace, told KCNA that many facilities of the palace were open to schoolchildren for their after-school activities.
					
					 A museum of the palace provides them with knowledge about animals and plants through several hundred pieces of specimens.
					
					 At the palace they enjoy such activities as lecture, folktale-telling session, speech contest, poem recitation, film and puppet shows and physical training.
					
					 What is most attractive to them is an astronomical observatory on the top floor of the palace.
					
					 Kim Jong Sun, a teacher of the observatory, said that schoolchildren can observe solar activities and take a close-up view of such stars as Orion's Belt and the polar star through astronomical telescopes and planetariums. A total solar eclipse was viewed there by many boys and girls on July 22 last year, she added.

articles.title: Pothong River Area Undergoes Great Change
articles.content:
Pothong River Area Undergoes Great Change
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Sixty-four years has elapsed since a ceremony took place to start the project for improvement of the Pothong River in Pyongyang, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 On this occasion many people have visited the Pothong River Improvement Project Memorial Tower to learn about the grand nature-harnessing projects of the country kicked off by President
						 Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The President called for launching nature-remaking projects with the start of the river improvement work as part of the effort for the building of a prosperous sovereign state, democratic and independent, and broke the ground for the work on May 21, Juche 35 (1946).
					
					 Though vast, the project was finished in only 55 days thanks to his wise leadership and devoted labor of citizens.
					
					 Since then the river, which had easily overflowed its banks, claiming many casualties and enormous material damage, before the liberation of the country from the Japanese colonial rule, has undergone a great change.
					
					 Constructed on the river were Mansudae, Changgwang, Chollima and Rakwon streets with high-rise apartment buildings and such monumental edifices as the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, the People's Palace of Culture and the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium.
					
					 The river is flanked with pleasure parks covering some 300 hectares in about 10km sections and with a large number of trees, flowers and shrubs.
					
					 The river has islets, large and small, and boating grounds, while the pleasure parks have fishponds, pools and public service facilities.

articles.title: Not Forget Bitter Lesson Drawn from Kwangju Uprising
articles.content:
Not Forget Bitter Lesson Drawn from Kwangju Uprising
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The Kwangju Popular Uprising in south Korea three decades ago was a patriotic and heroic armed resistance to put an end to outsiders' domination and military dictators' fascist rule and realize the desire for independence, democracy and reunification, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in a signed commentary.
					 Urging the south Koreans not to forget a bitter lesson taught by the Kwangju resistance, the commentary goes on:
					
					 The bitter lesson taught by the Kwangju Popular Uprising is that it is impossible to escape such disaster as Kwangju massacre nor is it possible to realize the people's desire for independence, democracy and reunification as long as aggressors and traitors are allowed to lord it over south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. is neither "friend" nor "guardian" of the south Korean people but an aggressor inflicting only pain, misfortune and death upon them. The present ruling forces of south Korea are a group of traitors as they bars the nation from independently carving out its destiny while staying in power by clinging to the coattails of outsiders in betrayal of the country and the nation.
					
					 If the south Koreans struggle with the same indomitable mettle and staunch fighting spirit as displayed by the Kwangju resistance fighters, they can certainly build an independent and democratic new society free from aggressors and traitors and reunify the country, concludes the commentary.

articles.title: Struggle for Independence Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle for Independence Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea issued a statement on Tuesday on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the Kwangju Popular Uprising.
					 The statement recalled that citizens of Kwangju kindled the flame of the struggle for democracy against dictatorship 30 years ago, clearly demonstrating the spirit of people's resistance against the fascist dictatorial forces.
					
					 The true nature of the U.S. which stands against the democratization of the south Korean society and the reunification of the divided Korean nation was brought into bolder relief in this period, the statement said.
					
					 It called upon all the people to turn out in the struggle to judge the present conservative ruling forces and get the humiliating south Korea-U.S. "alliance" for aggression scrapped by inheriting the spirit of the participants in the May 18 Kwangju resistance.
					
					 It stressed the need for the people to fight against the present regime which only deteriorates people's livelihood and, at the same time, categorically reject the war moves of the U.S. and drive its forces, the root cause of war, out of south Korea.
					
					 The statement called upon all the people to more dynamically conduct the struggle for independence, democracy and reunification by their concerted efforts.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- One day in April Juche 94 (2005) General Secretary Kim Jong Il inspected a unit of the Korean People's Army.
					 When he arrived at the unit early in the morning, the commanding officers of the unit were surprised by his early coming.
					
					 After exchanging greetings with them, he told them that he had planned to visit the unit in the afternoon, but altered his schedule as the weather forecast said it would rain from the morning. He then said that after the inspection he wanted to have a photo taken with servicepersons of the unit, not getting them wet in the rain.
					
					 Learning the reason why he came so early, the officers and soldiers of the unit were deeply moved by his meticulous care for them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong
Pyongyang, 21 de mayo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno el Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong.
					 Tras escuchar explicaciones ante el plano, recorrio durante largo tiempo el interior del taller de colada nuevamente edificado enterandose de los detalles del estado de construccion y equipos tecnicos.
					
					 Al ver los procesos productivos en cadena equipados segun la tecnologia sofisticada y las areas de trabajo acondicionadas de manera ordenada, expreso su gran satisfaccion por la magnifica construccion del taller.
					
					 Deviene un exito realmente grande el que los funcionarios, obreros y tecnicos del Complejo procuraron un nuevo viraje en la innovacion de colada construyendo con sus propias fuerzas este taller conforme a la demanda de la epoca IT, dijo y evaluo altamente sus meritos.
					
					  Este taller ocupa un lugar importante en la produccion de las piezas fundidas en la zona litoral del Mar Este, dijo y presento las tareas que incumben al taller.
					
					  Para modernizar la fabrica e incrementar la produccion de maquinas, son importantes los procesos basicos como la fundicion, la colada y la forja de acero, subrayo y continuo que hay que elevar incesantemente el papel del taller dotado de equipos ultramodernos.
					
					 Senalo que a fin de normalizar en un alto nivel la colada y elevar la calidad de los productos, es preciso intensificar la educacion tecnica de los tecnicos y  obreros.
					
					  A continuacion, el Dirigente recorrio el taller de maquinaria No. 4 y otros lugares cerciorandose del estado de produccion de los equipos a usar en los importantes proyectos.
					
					 Tras enterarse minuciosamente de la estructura, la eficiencia y los principios de operacion del compresor centrifugo de 90 mil metros cubicos y otras modernas maquinas grandes, que llenan el taller, se puso muy complacido de que los obreros de Ryongsong hayan hecho otra magnifica creacion que hara gran aporte a la prosperidad y al desarrollo del pais.
					
					 Gracias al dinamico apoyo de muchas potentes fabricas de maquinaria como este complejo, nuestro pais pudo realizar con exito la industrializacion socialista en un tiempo tan corto y fortalecer con rapidez el poderio economico del pais, dijo.
					
					 Esto deviene la manifestacion fehaciente de la justeza y la gran vitalidad de la original linea economica de nuestro partido de dar prioridad al desarrollo de la industria pesada cuyo nucleo es la industria de maquinaria y desarrollar al mismo tiempo la industria ligera y la agricultura.
					
					 El Dirigente presento las tareas programaticas a ser cumplidas por el complejo.
					
					 Enfatizo en que hay que acelerar activamente la modernizacion y la fundamentacion cientifica del complejo y aplicar ampliamente las tecnicas avanzadas para llevar a la nueva etapa alta la industria de maquinaria conforme a la demanda del nuevo siglo.
					
					 El Dirigente se fotografio junto a los innovadores laborales del complejo.
					
					 Ese dia, tras recorrer la ciudad de Hamhung, dirigio las labores de los importantes sectores economicos de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur examinando la maqueta de formacion arquitectonica urbana y los planes de esos dominios.
					
					 Puesto que Hamhung es la ciudad industrial donde viven muchos obreros, hay que construirla con vistas al futuro materializando estrictamente el principio socialista y el popular, senalo y enseno el rumbo y remedios concretos para el particular.
					
					  Le acompanaron el secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Sur, Thae Jong Su, el secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, los jefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui y Jang Song Thaek, los primeros subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Ju Kyu Chang y Ri Je Gang, y los jefes de departamento del CDN, Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige la Universidad de Industria Quimica de Hamhung
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige la Universidad de Industria Quimica de Hamhung
 Pyongyang, 21 de mayo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Universidad de Industria Quimica de Hamhung.
					  El Dirigente vio los datos de exitos logrados por este plantel docente en la investigacion cientifica durante los ultimos anos.
					
					  La universidad cumplio exitosamente muchas tareas de estudio de valor que revisten el significado importante en el desarrollo de la industria del pais  al librar energicamente la lucha por cumplir a costa de la vida las tareas combativas dadas en noviembre de hace 4 anos por el Dirigente durante su visita de orientacion a esta universidad.
					
					  El Dirigente recibio el informe sobre el estado de investigacion y expreso su gran satisfaccion de que los profesores, empelados y estudiantes de la universidad hayan logrado exitos en la investigacion de nueva tecnica de punta dedicando sus inteligencias y entusiasmo.
					
					  Dijo que estos exitos preciosos vuelven a mostrar fehacientemente la inagotable fuerza creadora y talentos del personal tecnico crecido en el regazo de nuestro partido.
					
					  Recorrio los laboratorios dotados con equipos sofisticados y otros varios lugares y se entero detalladamente del estado de la labor docente y la investigacion cientifica de la universidad.
					
					 Se mostro muy satisfecho de que los profesores y empleados de la universidad hayan creado el magnifico ambiente docente conforme a la demanda de la realidad en desarrollo y registrado nuevo cambio en la labor docente y la investigacion cientifica.
					
					  Enseno que la universidad fundada por la iniciativa del Presidente Kim Il Sung es el plantel benemerito que en el pasado formo un gran numero de tecnicos competentes capaces de encargarse de la industria quimica del pais y contribuyo grandemente a la construccion de la patria prospera.
					
					 Ahora, muchos graduados de este plantel docente cumplen el papel medular en solucionar numerosos problemas cientificos y tecnicos que se presentan en la industria quimica y otros sectores de la economia nacional y explotar nuevos dominios de ciencia y tecnica, dijo y continuo que nuestro partido y pueblo no se olvidaran eternamente de las proezas de los profesores, empleados y estudiantes de la universidad acumuladas ante el partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo.
					
					  Se reunio con los pedagogos e investigadores quienes durante largo tiempo hicieron un aporte especial en la ensenanza e investigacion cientifica en la universidad y los estimulo cordialmente.
					
					 Evaluo altamente los meritos de los profesores e investigadores diciendo que estos son los revolucionarios fieles que dedicaron todo lo suyo por la prosperidad de la patria y se fotografio junto a ellos.
					
					  El Dirigente presento las tareas programaticas que le incumben al plantel docente.
					
					  Solo cuando se formen muchas reservas de los competentes cientificos y tecnicos preparados de manera multilateral es posible desarrollar la economia del pais y llevar al nivel mundial nuestras ciencias y tecnicas en un corto tiempo, senalo y subrayo que la universidad debe criar mucho mas a los talentosos tecnicos capaces de contribuir activamente a consolidar con mas firmeza la base de la economia nacional independiente del pais y poner de pleno manifiesto su potencialidad.
					
					  Destaco que la universidad hay que formar mucho mas en un corto tiempo a los cientificos y tecnicos con alto nivel tecnico, de manera que solucione los problemas inmediatos pendientes en realizar la jucheanizacion, la modernizacion y la fundamentacion cientifica de la economia nacional y, al mismo tiempo, forjar ampliamente nuevos dominios de cientificos y tecnicos que tienen suma importancia en el desarrollo de la industria quimica del pais. 
					
					  A fin de desarrollar las ciencias y tecnicas conforme a la demanda de la epoca de la economia intelectual es preciso armarse con los nuevos conocimientos tecnicos, dijo y agrego que hay que desplegar animadamente las labores para introducir las ciencias avanzadas bajo la estrecha relacion con los institutos cientificos y universidades.
					
					  Asevero que deben utilizar de manera eficiente los laboratorios de categoria suprema para formar a los estudiantes como competentes tecnicos y valientes conquistadores de la tecnologia de punta.
					
					 Con miras a apoyar con las ciencias y tecnicas el movimiento de avance de nuestro pueblo que produce el gran auge revolucionario por la construccion de la patria prospera, debemos incrementar incesantemente las filas de los cientificos y tecnicos, menciono e hizo hincapie en la necesidad de conquistar lo mas pronto posible la cima de la gran potencia prospera con la fuerza de las ciencias y tecnicas.
					
					  El Dirigente expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que todos los profesores, empleados y estudiantes de la universidad, bien conscientes de la importancia de su deber asumido en el desarrollo de la industria quimica del pais, traeran un nuevo viraje en la formacion del personal cientifico y tecnico y en el desarrollo de esta rama. 
					
					  En la ocasion el fue acompanado por el secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Sur, Thae Jong Su, el secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, los jefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui y Jang Song Thaek, los primeros subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Ju Kyu Chang y Ri Je Gang, y los jefes de departamento del CDN, Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su.

articles.title: CRPP rechaza el "resultado de investigacion" del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
CRPP rechaza el "resultado de investigacion" del Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 21 de mayo (ATCC) -- En relacion con que los titeres surcoreanos publicaron el muy provocativo "resultado de investigacion" del incidente de hundimiento de un buque del ejercito titere surcoreano calumniando a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) publico el dia 21 una declaracion.
					La publicacion del "resultado de investigacion" deviene otro gran complot que invento la banda de los titeres surcoreanos por su temor al poderio de la RPDC, que avanza con pasos firmes hacia la gran potencia prospera, y con el fin de mellar la dignidad de esta y aplastarla librando de continuo la campana de "sancion" en contubernio con sus amos norteamericano y japones.
					
					Desde el principio, la banda de Lee Myung Bak, enloquecida por la confrontacion fratricida, supuso que fue el Norte quien hundio el buque y realizo en este sentido esa intrigante investigacion.
					
					Al cabo de la investigacion que duro casi dos meses, la banda titere invento a base de hipotesis y conjeturas sin fundamento la llamada "prueba circunstancial" y presento como "materiales de prueba" unos pedazos de hierro y aluminio, que nadie sabe de donde ella ha sacado, lo cual ha sido buen motivo de burla.
					
					Lo mas ridiculo es que ellos relacionan intencionalmente con la RPDC esos materiales, que no tienen ninguna marca ni nacionalidad, aduciendo que lo indican el analisis de composicion, el tamano y la forma de ellos.
					
					Esto no es mas que una locura de los fanaticos de la confrontacion con la RPDC.
					
					Al mismo tiempo, constituye el complot ideado premeditadamente por la camarilla de Lee Myung Bak, condenada a la bancarrota, para eludir la grave crisis emanada de su fracasada politica exterior e interior, mantener su dominacion fascista celebrando sin problemas las "elecciones de autonomia local" y llevar a la ruptura las relaciones N-S. 
					
					Ahora los titeres crean en el Sur de Corea un ambiente igual al estado de guerra hablando de "no vacilar en desatar la guerra" y de las "contramedidas" y dieron la orden supersecreta de evacuar con urgencia el personal, los equipos y los materiales surcoreanos, que estan en la RPDC, y de tomar las medidas para la seguridad personal y la retirada.
					
					Estos movimientos alborotados, que hacen creer que estamos en visperas de guerra, muestran que la publicacion del "resultado de investigacion" no es una simple aclaracion del caso de hundimiento del buque, sino una provocacion premeditada para procurar el pretexto de la guerra de agresion a la RPDC.
					
					Debido a la banda de titeres surcoreanos, la Peninsula Coreana se halla ahora en la coyuntura a punto de estallido de la guerra.
					
					De acuerdo con la declaracion del portavoz del Comite de Defensa Nacional y en representacion del gobierno de la RPDC, el CRPP declara solemnemente los siguientes puntos:
					
					Primero, a partir de este momento consideramos la situacion actual como coyuntura de guerra y encararemos todos los problemas que se presentan en las relaciones Norte-Sur desde tal punto de vista. 
					
					Segundo, en caso de que la banda de titeres acceda a la "represalia" y "venganza" pretextando el hundimiento del buque, le daremos una respuesta rotunda con castigos implacables como la ruptura total de las relaciones Norte-Sur, la invalidacion total del acuerdo Norte-Sur de no agresion y la cancelacion total de la cooperacion Norte-Sur. 
					
					No perdonaremos ni en lo minimo a todos los que insulten nuestra dignidad suprema y atenten contra nuestro pais.

articles.title: Futbolistas coreanas vencen a las tailandesas
articles.content:
Futbolistas coreanas vencen a las tailandesas
 Pyongyang, 21 de mayo (ATCC) -- Quedo iniciada el dia 19 la Competencia de Futbol Femenina por la Copa Asiatica 2010.
					 En el torneo que tiene lugar en Chengdu, China, hasta el dia 30, participan los equipos de 8 paises y regiones de Asia.
					
					 La llave A de serie en grupo por el sistema de uno contra todos esta compuesta de Corea, Myanmar, Tailandia y Japon.
					
					 El equipo coreano vencio 3 a 0 en su primer partido con el tailandes.
					
					 Competira el dia 22 con el de Myanmar.
